      74. 74
        Yang, J.; Yue, Q.; Li, G. D.; Cao, J. J.; Li, G. H.; Chen, J. S. Inorg. Chem. 2006, 45, 2857– 2865
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        74
        Structures, photoluminescence, up-conversion, and magnetism of two- and three-dimensional rare-Earth coordination polymers with multicarboxylate linkages
        Yang, Jin; Yue, Qi; Li, Guo-Dong; Cao, Jun-Jun; Li, Guang-Hua; Chen, Jie-Sheng
        Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (7), 2857-2865CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new rare-earth compds., [Eu(NDC)1.5(DMF)2] (1), [Nd2(NDC)3(DMF)4]·H2O (2), [La2(NDC)3(DMF)4]·0.5H2O (3), and [Eu(BTC)(H2O)] (4), where NDC = 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate, BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate, were synthesized through preheating and cooling-down crystn. Compds. 1-3 possess similar two-dimensional structures in which the NDC ligands link MIII (M = La, Nd, and Eu) ions of two adjacent double chains constructed by NDC ligands and dinuclear MIII building units. In compd. 4, the EuIII ion is seven-coordinated by O atoms from six BTC ligands and one terminal H2O mol. in a distorted pentagonal-bipyramidal coordination environment. If the BTC ligand and the EuIII ion are regarded as six-connected nodes, resp., the structure of compd. 4 can be well described as a three-dimensional six-connected net. Also, compds. 1 and 4 exhibit strong red luminescence upon 355-nm excitation. Compd. 2 displays interesting emissions in the near-IR region, and yellow (580 nm) pumping of this compd. results in UV and intense blue emissions through an up-conversion process. The magnetic properties of compds. 1, 2, and 4 were studied through measurement of their magnetic susceptibilities at 4-300 K.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhvVequrk%253D&md5=f22b4c2f18a247d539963d00d3943874
      75. 75
        Zhang, L. P.; Ma, J. F.; Yang, J.; Pang, Y. Y.; Ma, J. C. Inorg. Chem. 2010, 49, 1535– 1550
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        75
        Series of 2D and 3D Coordination Polymers Based on 1,2,3,4-Benzenetetracarboxylate and N-Donor Ligands: Synthesis, Topological Structures, and Photoluminescent Properties
        Zhang, Lai-Ping; Ma, Jian-Fang; Yang, Jin; Pang, Yuan-Yuan; Ma, Ji-Cheng
        Inorganic Chemistry (2010), 49 (4), 1535-1550CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Nine new coordination polymers, namely, [Mn2(L)(H2O)4]·H2O (1), [Cd(L)0.5(H2O)] (2), [Zn5(L)2(μ3-O)2(H2O)4]·2H2O (3), [Zn4(L)2(μ3-O)2][Zn(H2O)6]·2H2O (4), [Zn2(L)(biim-4)0.5(H2O)3]·H2O (5), [Cd2(L)(bpy)(H2O)]·2H2O·0.5(CH3CH2OH) (6), [Cu2(H2L)2(bpy)2] (7), [Cu2(L)(bpy)(H2O)] (8), and [Cu2(L)(bpy)1.5(H2O)2.5] (9), where H4L = 1,2,3,4-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, biim-4 = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole), and bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 displays a rare trinodal (3,4,7)-connected (42·6)(45·6)(47·68·86) topol. 2 Possesses an α-Po net. 3 Is a novel 3-dimensional framework based on pentanuclear ZnII clusters. By adjustment of the pH values of the reaction mixt. of 3 with a Na2CO3 soln., a structurally different compd., 4, was obtained, which exhibits a 3-dimensional porous framework with the [Zn(H2O)6]2+ cations located in the channels. 5 Is an unusual example of a trinodal (3,5)-connected network with a Schlafli symbol of (42·6)(62·8)(42·62·85·10), whereas 6, contg. tetranuclear CdII clusters, shows a rare (4,6)-connected (44·62)2(44·610·8) topol. 7 Exhibits a unique polythreading network, while 8 displays a scarce trinodal (3,4,5)-connected self-penetrating network. In comparison with 8, the chiral compd. 9 possesses an unprecedented tetranodal (2,4)-connected (7)(75·11)(62·73·8)2(6·74 × 10)2 topol. The effects of the carboxylate ligands, the pH values, the reaction temps., the central metals, and the neutral ligands were elucidated. The IR spectra, TGA, and luminescent properties for the compds. were also studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXptlylsA%253D%253D&md5=d2c4a48059e1d759c93ead82c8efa09c
      76. 76
        Lin, J.-G.; Zang, S.-Q.; Tian, Z.-F.; Li, Y.-Z.; Xu, Y.-Y.; Zhu, H.-Z.; Meng, Q.-J. CrystEngComm 2007, 9, 915– 921
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        76
        Metal-organic frameworks constructed from mixed-ligand 1,2,3,4-tetra-(4-pyridyl)-butane and benzene-polycarboxylate acids: syntheses, structures and physical properties
        Lin, Jian-Guo; Zang, Shuang-Quan; Tian, Zhen-Fang; Li, Yi-Zhi; Xu, Yan-Yan; Zhu, Hui-Zhen; Meng, Qing-Jin
        CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (10), 915-921CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Three novel coordination polymers, [Mn(TPB)0.5(IPA)(H2O)2]n (1), [Zn1.5(TPB)0.5(TMA)(H2O)·(H2O)]n (2), and [Co(TPB)0.5(PMA)0.5(H2O)2·(H2O)]n (3) (TPB = 1,2,3,4-tetra-(4-pyridyl)-butane; H2IPA = isophthalic acid; H3TMA = trimesic acid; and H4PMA = pyromellitic acid) were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized. Complex 1 features a 2-dimensional infinite layer framework consisting of bi-manganese clusters, which is further stacked along the [‾111] direction via strong interlayer π···π interactions to form a 3-dimensional supramol. architecture. Complex 2 has a 3-dimensional complicated framework comprised of two kinds of infinite 1-dimensional chains. The 3-dimensional framework of complex 3 possesses three topol. nonequivalent 4-connected nodes synchronously and exhibits an unprecedented (64·102)(42·84)(4·65)2 topol. The magnetic susceptibility data of complex 1 show strong antiferromagnetic interactions in the dinuclear Mn(II) units. Complex 2 exhibits strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. and may be suitable as a candidate of blue-fluorescent material.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtleqtbvL&md5=4f3f709d93e18d197dccf45e06b8560e
      77. 77
        Wen, L.-L.; Li, Y.-Z.; Lu, Z.-D.; Lin, J.-G.; Duan, C.-Y.; Meng, Q.-J. Cryst. Growth Des. 2006, 6, 530– 537
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        77
        Syntheses and Structures of Four d10 Metal-Organic Frameworks Assembled with Aromatic Polycarboxylate and bix [bix = 1,4-Bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene]
        Wen, Lili; Li, Yizhi; Lu, Zhenda; Lin, Jianguo; Duan, Chunying; Meng, Qingjin
        Crystal Growth & Design (2006), 6 (2), 530-537CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Four novel cadmium(II) or zinc(II) metal coordination polymers [Cd2(2,3-pydc)2(bix)3·2H2O]n (1), [Cd2(μ2-OH2)(2,6-pydc)2(bix)]n (2), [Cd3(SIP)2(bix)4·8H2O]n (3) and [Zn2(SIP)(bix)3(OH)·2H2O]n (4) (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene; 2,3-pydc = pyridine-2,3-dicarboxylate; 2,6-pydc = pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylate; SIP = 5-sulfoisophthalate) have been synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized. The mol. structures of 1-4 were detd. by X-ray crystallog. Polymer 1 features a 3D porous framework with uncoordinated water mols. trapped in the pores. Polymer 2 is a 2D infinite layer framework and the resulting 2D structure is interconnected by hydrogen-bond interactions to lead to a 3D supramol. architecture. Polymer 3 also possesses a 3D porous framework in which the most prominent cavities are parallel to the a- and b- directions and are filled with free water mols. Polymer 4 exhibits 4-fold interpenetration related by three different translation vectors. These four compds. exhibit strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. and could be significant in the field of photoactive materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xhtw%253D%253D&md5=2a65d6ea85f0df445b7463591b66cead
      78. 78
        Wen, L.-L.; Lu, Z.-D.; Lin, J.-G.; Tian, Z.-F.; Zhu, H.-Z.; Meng, Q.-J. Cryst. Growth Des. 2007, 7, 93– 99
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        78
        Syntheses, Structures, and Physical Properties of Three Novel Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids and Flexible Imidazole-Based Synthons
        Wen, Lili; Lu, Zhenda; Lin, Jianguo; Tian, Zhengfang; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin
        Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (1), 93-99CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three novel interesting coordination polymers, [Cd3(SIP)2(bbi)5·3H2O]n (1), [Co3(SIP)2(bix)4(2H2O)·2H2O]n (2), and [Cd(2,5-pydc)2(bix)1.5·H2O]n (3) (SIP = 5-sulfoisophthalic acid monosodium salt; bbi = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole); bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)-benzene; 2,5-pydc = pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid), were isolated under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized. Polymer 1 has a 3-dimensional complicated framework comprised of an infinite 1-dimensional ladder-like chain and 2-dimensional layer structure. Polymer 2 features a 3-dimensional hydrated framework with uncoordinated H2O mols. trapped in the pores. Polymer 3 is a 2-dimensional infinite layer framework, which is further interconnected by H-bond interactions to lead to a 3-dimensional supramol. architecture. Compds. 1 and 3 exhibit medium-strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. and could be significant in the field of photoactive materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xht12itb7K&md5=afbe6b00336b9500cbb1b559d7532caa
      79. 79
        Kent, C. A.; Liu, D.; Ito, A.; Zhang, T.; Brennaman, M. K.; Meyer, T. J.; Lin, W. J. Mater. Chem. A 2013, 1, 14982– 14989
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        79
        Rapid energy transfer in non-porous metal-organic frameworks with caged Ru(bpy)32+ chromophores: oxygen trapping and luminescence quenching
        Kent, Caleb A.; Liu, Demin; Ito, Akitaka; Zhang, Teng; Brennaman, M. Kyle; Meyer, Thomas J.; Lin, Wenbin
        Journal of Materials Chemistry A: Materials for Energy and Sustainability (2013), 1 (47), 14982-14989CODEN: JMCAET; ISSN:2050-7496. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two non-porous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) with caged Ru(bpy)32+ chromophores, [Ru(bpy)3][Zn2(C2O4)3] (1) and [Ru(bpy)3][NaAl(C2O4)3] (2), were synthesized and characterized. Their emission properties were studied by both steady-state and time-resolved luminescence measurements. Air-free microcrystals of 1 and 2 exhibit long-lived triplet metal-to-ligand charge transfer (3MLCT) excited states with lifetimes of 760 and 1305 ns, resp. Lifetimes are significantly shortened (to 92 ns for 1 and 144 ns for 2) by trapping of trace amts. of oxygen in the non-porous MOFs, presumably due to amplified luminescence quenching of Ru(bpy)32+*. Following MLCT excitation, Ru(bpy)32+*/Ru(bpy)32+ energy transfer migration in 1 and 2 results in efficient quenching of Ru(bpy)32+* by Os(bpy)32+ added as an energy transfer trap at doping levels of 0.2-1.0%. A kinetic anal. indicates that the three-dimensional chromophore connectivity in 1 and 2 provides a network for rapid excited state energy transfer migration among Ru(bpy)32+ units, ultimately, finding an Os(bpy)32+ trap site. These cryst. frameworks with caged chromophores have proven to be ideal systems for studying light harvesting processes in artificial supramol. systems.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhslOkt77K&md5=0a65aaf2d60b21e9ceeb2c8771cf99a4
      80. 80
        He, Y.-H.; Feng, Y.-L.; Lan, Y.-Z.; Wen, Y.-H. Cryst. Growth Des. 2008, 8, 3586– 3594
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        80
        Syntheses, Structures, and Photoluminescence of Four d10 Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from 3,5-Bis-oxyacetate-benzoic Acid
        He, Yin-Hua; Feng, Yun-Long; Lan, You-Zhao; Wen, Yi-Hang
        Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (10), 3586-3594CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A new multicarboxylate ligand, 3,5-bis(carboxymethoxy)benzoic acid (H3BOABA), was designed and introduced to construct novel metal-org. framework materials with potential luminescent properties. Four complexes, Zn2(BOABA)(OH)·H2O (1), Zn4(BOABA)2(4,4'-bipy)2(OH)2·H2O·0.5CH3CH2OH (2), Cd3(BOABA)2(H2O)6·6H2O (3), and Cd4(BOABA)2(phen)4(OH)2·H2O (4), were synthesized hydrothermally and structurally characterized. 1 Features an unusual 5-connected 46.64 uninodal net with both the dinuclear Zn(II) unit and the BOABA ligand being the square pyramidal nodes. 2 Presents an interesting three-dimensional (3,8)-connected network constructed from pillared undulate layers, which shows large 1-dimensional channels with dimensions of 11.97 × 13.82 Å along the a axis. The self-assembly between the Cd(II) ions and the BOABA ligand leads to a bilayer motif 3, whereas the presence of the auxiliary phen ligand results in a new compd. 4 with monolayer construction based on tetranuclear [Cd4(OH)2]6+ clusters. Photoluminescence studies reveal that these four complexes exhibit strong fluorescent emission bands in the solid state at room temp. The theoretic calcns. show that four complexes are indirect band gap semiconductors and the fluorescent emission peaks could be attributed to the ligand-ligand charge transfer. The thermal stabilities of these complexes were also examd.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhtVSrtLjL&md5=1ea9d6e6a13e7001183a7f9cc6bc1621
      81. 81
        Zheng, S.-L.; Tong, M.-L.; Tan, S.-D.; Wang, Y.; Shi, J.-X.; Tong, Y.-X.; Lee, H.-K.; Chen, X.-M. Organometallics 2001, 20, 5319– 5325
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        81
        Syntheses, Structures, and Properties of Three Novel Coordination Polymers of Silver(I) Aromatic Carboxylates with Hexamethylenetetramine Exhibiting Unique Metal-π Interaction
        Zheng, Shao-Liang; Tong, Ming-Liang; Tan, Song-De; Wang, Yu; Shi, Jian-Xin; Tong, Ye-Xiang; Lee, Hung Kay; Chen, Xiao-Ming
        Organometallics (2001), 20 (25), 5319-5325CODEN: ORGND7; ISSN:0276-7333. (American Chemical Society)
        Three interesting coordination polymers, [Ag4(μ4-hmt)(μ4-η2-nda)2]·2H2O (1), [Ag2(μ-hmt)2(μ-bi-η2-bna)]·2H2O·MeCN (2), and [Ag2(μ4-hmt)(η2-hna)(MeCN)](hna)·H2O (3) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine, nda = 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylate, bna = 2,2'-dihydroxy-1,1'-binaphthalene-3,3'-dicarboxylate, and hna = 1-hydroxy-2-naphthalenecarboxylate), were obtained from the reaction of silver(I) arom. carboxylates in MeCN soln. with hmt in CH2Cl2 soln. via the liq. diffusion method. In these complexes, the arom. carboxylates ligate to the metal atoms via a unique η2-coordination mode involving their arom. rings, in addn. to the normal coordination modes utilizing their carboxylate oxygen atoms. These complexes show interesting electronic properties similar to those reported for the silver(I) complexes of other polycyclic arom. compds. Both 1 and 2 exhibit a strong blue photoluminescence at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXotV2ksro%253D&md5=de3716f7dc414db9046c5a39b05f4357
      82. 82
        Zheng, S.-L.; Yang, J.-H.; Yu, X.-L.; Chen, X.-M.; Wong, W.-T. Inorg. Chem. 2004, 43, 830– 838
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        82
        Syntheses, Structures, Photoluminescence, and Theoretical Studies of d10 Metal Complexes of 2,2'-Dihydroxy-[1,1']binaphthalenyl-3,3'-dicarboxylate
        Zheng, Shao-Liang; Yang, Jin-Hua; Yu, Xiao-Lan; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Wong, Wing-Tak
        Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (2), 830-838CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The free solvated ligand, H2bna·MeOH·H2O (1), and its dimeric complex, [Cd2(bna)2(H2O)6] (2) (bna = 2,2'-dihydroxy-[1,1']-binaphthalene-3,3'-dicarboxylate), were obtained by evapn. of the solns., while two new d10 metal-hydroxy cluster-based coordination polymers, [Cd8(OH)4(H2O)10(bna)6]·17H2O (3) and [Hpy]2[Zn4(OH)2(H2O)2(bna)4]·2H2O·2MeCN (4), were obtained by a hydrothermal route. All the compds. were characterized by x-ray crystallog. and photoluminescence measurements. Compd. 1 consists of a three-dimensional, H-bonded supramol. array, 2 exhibits a dimeric mol. featuring a square motif organized by two Cd(II) atoms and two bna ligands each at the corner, and 3 contains unprecedented [Cd8(μ3-OH)2(μ-OH)2(μ-H2O)2]12+ octanuclear metallacrown cores which are interlinked through bna to afford a two-dimensional structure, while 4 features layers with butterfly-shaped [Zn4(μ3-OH)2]6+ clusters. All the complexes display photoluminescent properties in the blue/green range. The manifestation of photoluminescence, as probed by MO calcns. performed on the complexes and also on hypothetical multinuclear complexes, is attributed to a ligand-to-metal charge-transfer mechanism. In addn. to presenting a new approach for the study of the photoluminescent properties of metal-cluster-based coordination polymers by using simple model compds., the study also reveals the dominant role of the structure of the ligand over that of the d10 metal-hydroxy (or oxy) cluster and the presence of the cluster significantly increasing the emission lifetime.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXnt1w%253D&md5=e62d73a4481385bcf409a5682ce12b75
